IRS990.MissionDesc: THE CANTON FOUNDATION WAS FORMED IN 1973 TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT CANTON. THE FOUNDATION PROVIDES STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, SUPPORTS FACULTY AND STAFF DEVELOPMENT, AND PROMOTES CAMPUS ENHANCEMENT PROJECTS.
IRS990.Desc: REAL PROPERTY MANAGEMENT - CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS SOLE OWNER OF GRASSE RIVER, LLC, HEMLOCK ACRES, LLC, AND RIVER ROO, LLC. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THESE ORGANIZATIONS IS TO ACQUIRE, MAINTAIN, AND MANAGE REAL PROPERTY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COLLEGE. RENTAL REVENUES AND RELATED EXPENSES ARE FROM STUDENT HOUSING DEVELOPED AND MANAGED BY GRASSE RIVER, LLC, AND LAND RENT FROM HEMLOCK ACRES, LLC.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. PROVIDES EMERGENCY STUDENT LOANS OF A MAXIMUM OF $400 PER LOAN TO STUDENTS OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT CANTON. THE CRITERIA FOR OBTAINING THESE LOANS IS DEMONSTRATED NEED AND AVAILABLE FUTURE FUNDS RECEIVABLE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AT SUNY CANTON. THESE LOANS ARE REPAID TO CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION BY SUNY CANTON UPON RECEIPT BY SUNY CANTON OF FINANCIAL AID OR OTHER FUNDS ON BEHALF OF THE STUDENT. CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. CHARGES THE STUDENT A SMALL PROCESSING FEE PER LOAN FOR THIS SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARTWORK CONSISTING OF PAINTINGS AND PICTURES OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, THE COLLEGE OVER ITS 100 YEAR HISTORY, AND OTHER MISCELLANEOUS PAINTINGS, PICTURES AND SCULPTURES HAVE BEEN DONATED IN PAST YEARS TO PRESERVE THE HISTORY OF THE COLLEGE, AS WELL AS BEAUTIFY THE CAMPUS BUILDINGS.

THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE HELD TO FUND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE, IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR STIPULATIONS RELATED TO EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, INDIVIDUAL STUDENT NEED, OR OTHER REQUIREMENTS. ALL ANNUAL EARNINGS DISTRIBUTIONS FROM ENDOWED FUNDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE GOVERNING BODY.

THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE IRC, THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE FOUNDATION PRESENTLY DISCLOSES OR RECOGNIZES INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATE OF WHETHER IT IS REASONABLY POSSIBLE OR PROBABLE THAT A LIABILITY HAS BEEN INCURRED FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE FOUNDATION HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT IN ITS CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. U.S, FORMS 990 FILED BY THE FOUNDATION ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE FOUNDATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO TAX EXAMINATION FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2019, AND PRIOR.

SCHOLARSHIPS CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION ISSUES SCHOLARSHIPS TO BENEFIT STUDENTS OF SUNY CANTON DIRECTLY TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THE COLLEGE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE APPLIES THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD TO THE STUDENTS OUTSTANDING BALANCE WITH SUNY CANTON. OTHER INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENT IN THE FORM OF A CHECK AS A PROPERLY DOCUMENTED REIMBURSEMENT, OR PAID DIRECTLY TO A MERCHANT TO PURCHASE RELATED EQUIPMENT TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT A DEPARTMENT, PROGRAM OR THE CAMPUS. STUDENTS COMPLETE A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION WITH THE CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION TO REQUEST ASSISTANCE.THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF SUNY CANTON VERIFIES ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDENTS FOR ANY NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE MEETS TO REVIEW THE CRITERIA FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP AWARD ALONG WITH EACH APPLICATION TO DETERMINE THE AWARD OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP. FACULTY/STAFF GRANTS AND AWARDS. CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION GAVE OUT 43 CAMPUS ENHANCEMENT/FACULTY STAFF AWARDS. IN-KIND EACH YEAR THE FOUNDATION CONTRIBUTES GIFTS IN-KIND TO THE SUNY COLLEGE AT CANTON. THE VARIOUS ITEMS DONATED MAY INCLUDE BEAUTIFICATION OF THE CAMPUS SUCH AS TREES AND SHRUBS, BOOKS FOR THE LIBRARY COLLECTION, REPAIRS MANUALS FOR THE AUTOMOTIVE TECHNOLOGY PROGRAM AND/OR VARIOUS OTHER ITEMS TO SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE MISSION OF THE COLLEGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART 1, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RAISE FUNDS, ACCEPT GIFTS AND PROVIDE BOTH MONETARY AND NON-MONETARY SUPPORT TO THE STUDENTS, FACULTY, STAFF, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND CAMPUS-WIDE EFFORTS OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT CANTON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4B, PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENTS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A. TO ENCOURAGE, ACCEPT AND HOLD GIFTS MADE TO THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK (SUNY) AT CANTON IN THE FORM OF ANY AND ALL TYPES OF REAL OR PERSONAL PROPERTY. B. TO MANAGE SUCH PROPERTY RECEIVED IN (A) ABOVE AND COLLECT INCOME THERE FROM AND DISBURSE ANY OF THE SAME ONLY FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADVANCING THE WELFARE AND DEVELOPMENT OF SUNY CANTON. C. TO AID SUNY CANTON IN CARRYING OUT ITS COMMITMENT TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL QUALIFIED INDIVDUALS. D. TO MAKE SUCH GRANTS AND AWARDS OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND STAFF OF SAID COLLEGE AS SHALL BE CONSISTENT WITH THE PURPOSES AND POLICIES OF SUNY CANTON. E. TO MAKE SUCH GRANTS AND AWARDS OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO SAID COLLEGE AND TO ANY OTHER ORGANIZATION DULY AUTHORIZED BY THE COLLEGE TO CARRY ON CHARITABLE EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PROVIDING SAID ORGANIZATION QUALIFIES AS AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE CODE AND ITS REGULATIONS AS THEY NOW EXIST, OR AS THEY MAY HEREAFTER BE AMENDED. TO ACCOMPLISH THESE PURPOSES, CANTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. CARRIED ON THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES DURING THE FISCAL YEAR: 1. ACCEPTED IN-KIND GIFTS OF EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES AND TURNED THEM OVER TO SUNY CANTON FOR ITS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. 2. FUNDED ACTIVITIES AND MADE GRANTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE PROMOTION OF THE INSTITUTION AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT WITH THE CURRICULUM. 3. AWARDED FINANCIAL GRANTS AND WORK ASSISTANTSHIPS TO STUDENTS IN NEED BASED ON STIPULATED SELECTION CRITERIA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORTS TO THE FULL BOARD ON THE FINDINGS OF THEIR REVIEW. THE FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE FOR ANY BOARD MEMBER TO REVIEW AT OUR OFFICES. ADDITIONALLY, THE FORM 990 IS POSTED ON THE N.Y.S. CHARITIES BUREAU WEBSITE FOR PUBLIC REVIEW AND INSPECTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTORS ARE ASKED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THEY MAY HAVE WITH THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPARATIVE DATA IS COLLECTED FROM OTHER SUNY INSTITUTIONS FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THIS INFORMATION IS SHARED WITH THE BOARD CHAIR AS WELL AS THE PRESIDENT OF SUNY CANTON. BOTH INDIVIDUALS APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. DATA FOR KEY EMPLOYEES IS PROVIDED TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND BOARD CHAIR TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS. EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PERFORMANCE IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE PRESIDENT AND THE FOUNDATION BOARD. KEY EMPLOYEE ANNUAL PERFORAMANCE IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC REVIEW UPON REQUEST AT OUR OFFICES LOCATED AT 34 CORNELL DRIVE, CANTON, NY 13617. ADDITIONALLY, AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND 990 FILINGS ARE POSTED ON THE NYS ATTORNEY GENERAL CHARITIES BUREAU WEBSITE AS REQUIRED BY LAW.
NO CHANGES HAVE TAKEN PLACE DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: STATE UNIVERSITY OF NY AT CANTON

STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT CANTON
